sentences: Politsei mõrvas mehe pärast pikka uurimist.
Ta on süüdi mõrvas ja sai eluaegse vanglakaristuse.
context: The word 'mõrvas' is the past tense form of the Estonian verb 'mõrvama', which means 'to kill' or 'to murder'. It specifically refers to unlawful killing, typically with intent. This appears in legal contexts as well as general discussions about murder cases.
